page.title: 16ECOLOGY
page.content: The area around Rosedale has some very fine{scenery.}The moors are most attractive when the heather and ling is in bloom late in August and into September. The deep russet of the dead bracken and the orange and yellow of the leaves in Autumn contrasts with the green of the valley. There are many attractive and impressive{trees,}notably the copper beeches and the three sequoia.Many different trees line the{river}banks. Northdale Beck joins the Seven River (arising from 7 springs)at the Bow Bridge. The hills once abounded with {iron ore}and for years Rosedale was celebrated for it's rich and extensive deposits of magnetic ore. {Grouse and pheasant}supply good sport for the guns in the season. The stone shooting butts are a feature of the moor.
